intro: Alibertia myrciifolia var. tepuiensis, commonly known as the tepui alibertia, is a perennial shrub native to the tepuis of southern Venezuela and northern Colombia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features compound leaves with serrated margins and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
